page.title: 17Spring Farm Vineyard.
page.content: Wines and Vines:- There are 14 types of{vine}grown, 12 white and 2 black varieties. They are grown on a silty clay loam overlaying blue lias, which is a{limestone}rock formation with a high calcium content. The depth of soil varies from as little as 20-25cm at the highest point to 1m in the lowest growing area of the vineyard. the vineyard is about 12 acres in size, and lies 200-250 feet above sea level.{Farming}grapes is difficult. Some of the vines are grown on the Guyot System, in which the{fruiting canes are replaced each year, and the vines are grown in a hedge. Others are grown on the Geneva Double Curtain System, and the rest on the Open Lyre System recently developed in Bordeaux. To protect the vines, windbreaks of willow and poplar are used.
